trans-unit.source: When creating a new app in your Windows Dev Center dashboard, the app's name must be unique throughout the entire Store.
trans-unit.target: When creating a new app in your Windows Dev Center dashboard, the app's name must be unique throughout the entire Store.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to reserve names and includes some suggestions for choosing a great app name.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to reserve names and includes some suggestions for choosing a great app name.

trans-unit.source: Create your app by reserving a name
trans-unit.target: Create your app by reserving a name

trans-unit.source: Create your app by reserving a name
trans-unit.target: Create your app by reserving a name

trans-unit.source: When creating a new app in your Windows Dev Center dashboard, the app's name must be unique throughout the entire Store.
trans-unit.target: When creating a new app in your Windows Dev Center dashboard, the app's name must be unique throughout the entire Store.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to reserve names and includes some suggestions for [choosing a great app name](#choosing-your-app-s-name).
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to reserve names and includes some suggestions for [choosing a great app name](#choosing-your-app-s-name).

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you have a Windows Phone app that you created earlier, and you never reserved a name for it, you can still manage and submit that app.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you have a Windows Phone app that you created earlier, and you never reserved a name for it, you can still manage and submit that app.

trans-unit.source: However, in order to upload .appx packages for it, or to [view app identity details](view-app-identity-details.md) specific to creating .appx packages, you'll need to reserve a unique name by following the steps below.
trans-unit.target: However, in order to upload .appx packages for it, or to [view app identity details](view-app-identity-details.md) specific to creating .appx packages, you'll need to reserve a unique name by following the steps below.

trans-unit.source: This also prevents anyone else from reserving that name for themselves.
trans-unit.target: This also prevents anyone else from reserving that name for themselves.

trans-unit.source: When you [upload your app's packages](upload-app-packages.md), the [**Package/Properties/DisplayName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn423240) value must match the name that you reserved for your app in the **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: When you [upload your app's packages](upload-app-packages.md), the [**Package/Properties/DisplayName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn423240) value must match the name that you reserved for your app in the **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: If you use Microsoft Visual Studio to create your app's package, this attribute will be filled in for you.
trans-unit.target: If you use Microsoft Visual Studio to create your app's package, this attribute will be filled in for you.

trans-unit.source: Create your app by reserving a new name
trans-unit.target: Create your app by reserving a new name

trans-unit.source: Reserving a name is the first step in creating an app in the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Reserving a name is the first step in creating an app in the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: You can do this even if you haven't started to build your app yet.
trans-unit.target: You can do this even if you haven't started to build your app yet.

trans-unit.source: We recommend doing it as soon as possible, so that nobody else can use the name.
trans-unit.target: We recommend doing it as soon as possible, so that nobody else can use the name.

trans-unit.source: From the **Dashboard overview** or **All apps** page, click **Create a new app**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Dashboard overview** or **All apps** page, click **Create a new app**.

trans-unit.source: In the text box, enter the name that you want to use, and then click the **Check availability** link.
trans-unit.target: In the text box, enter the name that you want to use, and then click the **Check availability** link.

trans-unit.source: If the name is available, you'll see a green check mark.
trans-unit.target: If the name is available, you'll see a green check mark.

trans-unit.source: (If the name you entered is already reserved or in use by another developer, you'll see a message that the name is not available.)
trans-unit.target: (If the name you entered is already reserved or in use by another developer, you'll see a message that the name is not available.)

trans-unit.source: Click **Reserve app name**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Reserve app name**.

trans-unit.source: The name is now reserved for you and you can start working on your [submission](app-submissions.md) whenever you're ready.
trans-unit.target: The name is now reserved for you and you can start working on your [submission](app-submissions.md) whenever you're ready.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Because names can be reserved for one year, you might find that you can't reserve a name, even though you don't see any apps listed by that name in the Store.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Because names can be reserved for one year, you might find that you can't reserve a name, even though you don't see any apps listed by that name in the Store.

trans-unit.source: This is usually because another developer has reserved the name for their app but hasn't submitted it yet.
trans-unit.target: This is usually because another developer has reserved the name for their app but hasn't submitted it yet.

trans-unit.source: If you are unable to reserve a name for which you hold the trademark or other legal right, or if you see another app in the Windows Store using that name, [contact Microsoft](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=233777).
trans-unit.target: If you are unable to reserve a name for which you hold the trademark or other legal right, or if you see another app in the Windows Store using that name, [contact Microsoft](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=233777).

trans-unit.source: After you reserve a name, you'll have one year to submit that app.
trans-unit.target: After you reserve a name, you'll have one year to submit that app.

trans-unit.source: If you don't submit it within the year, the reservation will expire and another developer could use that name for an app.
trans-unit.target: If you don't submit it within the year, the reservation will expire and another developer could use that name for an app.

trans-unit.source: You may encounter an error if you try to submit an app under a name which you have let expire.
trans-unit.target: You may encounter an error if you try to submit an app under a name which you have let expire.

trans-unit.source: Choosing your app's name
trans-unit.target: Choosing your app's name

trans-unit.source: Choosing the right name for your app is an important task.
trans-unit.target: Choosing the right name for your app is an important task.

trans-unit.source: Pick a name that will capture your customers' interest and draw them in to learn more about your app.
trans-unit.target: Pick a name that will capture your customers' interest and draw them in to learn more about your app.

trans-unit.source: Here are some tips for choosing a great app name.
trans-unit.target: Here are some tips for choosing a great app name.

trans-unit.source: Keep it short.
trans-unit.target: Keep it short.

trans-unit.source: The space to display your app's name is limited in many places, so we suggest using the shortest name as you can.
trans-unit.target: The space to display your app's name is limited in many places, so we suggest using the shortest name as you can.

trans-unit.source: While your app's name can have up to 256 characters, the end of a very long name may not always be visible to customers.
trans-unit.target: While your app's name can have up to 256 characters, the end of a very long name may not always be visible to customers.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The actual number of characters displayed in various locations may vary, depending on the length allotted and on the types of characters used in your app's name.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The actual number of characters displayed in various locations may vary, depending on the length allotted and on the types of characters used in your app's name.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the Segoe UI font that Windows uses, about 30 "I" characters will fit in the same space as 10 "W" characters.
trans-unit.target: For example, in the Segoe UI font that Windows uses, about 30 "I" characters will fit in the same space as 10 "W" characters.

trans-unit.source: Because of this variation, be sure to test your app and verify how its name appears on its tiles (if you choose to overlay the app name), in search results, and within the app itself before you submit your app.
trans-unit.target: Because of this variation, be sure to test your app and verify how its name appears on its tiles (if you choose to overlay the app name), in search results, and within the app itself before you submit your app.

trans-unit.source: Also consider each language in which you offer your app.
trans-unit.target: Also consider each language in which you offer your app.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that East-Asian characters tend to be wider than Latin characters, so fewer characters will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that East-Asian characters tend to be wider than Latin characters, so fewer characters will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: Avoid adding differentiating info at the end of the name.
trans-unit.target: Avoid adding differentiating info at the end of the name.

trans-unit.source: If the info that differentiates multiple apps is added to the end of a name, customers might miss it, especially if the name is long; all of the apps could appear to have the same name.
trans-unit.target: If the info that differentiates multiple apps is added to the end of a name, customers might miss it, especially if the name is long; all of the apps could appear to have the same name.

trans-unit.source: If this is unavoidable, use different logos and app images so it's easier to differentiate one app from another.
trans-unit.target: If this is unavoidable, use different logos and app images so it's easier to differentiate one app from another.

trans-unit.source: Be original.
trans-unit.target: Be original.

trans-unit.source: Make sure your app name is distinctive enough so that it isn't easily confused with an existing app.
trans-unit.target: Make sure your app name is distinctive enough so that it isn't easily confused with an existing app.

trans-unit.source: Don't use names trademarked by others.
trans-unit.target: Don't use names trademarked by others.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have the rights to use the name that you reserve.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you have the rights to use the name that you reserve.

trans-unit.source: If someone else has trademarked the name, they can report an infringement and you won't be able to keep using that name.
trans-unit.target: If someone else has trademarked the name, they can report an infringement and you won't be able to keep using that name.

trans-unit.source: If that happens after your app has been published, it will be removed from the Store.
trans-unit.target: If that happens after your app has been published, it will be removed from the Store.

trans-unit.source: You'll then need to change the name of your app, and all instances of the name throughout your app and its content, before you can [submit your app](app-submissions.md) for certification again.
trans-unit.target: You'll then need to change the name of your app, and all instances of the name throughout your app and its content, before you can [submit your app](app-submissions.md) for certification again.

trans-unit.source: Manage additional app names
trans-unit.target: Manage additional app names

trans-unit.source: You can manage names for your apps on the **Manage app names** page in the **App management** section for each of your apps in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
trans-unit.target: You can manage names for your apps on the **Manage app names** page in the **App management** section for each of your apps in the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, you may want to reserve multiple names to use for the same app, such as when you want to offer your app in multiple languages and want to use different names.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, you may want to reserve multiple names to use for the same app, such as when you want to offer your app in multiple languages and want to use different names.

trans-unit.source: You will need to reserve an additional name if you want to change an app's name completely.
trans-unit.target: You will need to reserve an additional name if you want to change an app's name completely.

trans-unit.source: On this page, you can also delete any names that you have reserved but no longer want to use.
trans-unit.target: On this page, you can also delete any names that you have reserved but no longer want to use.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Manage app names](manage-app-names.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Manage app names](manage-app-names.md).
